djangotailoring.surveys.views.render¶

Classes¶

SurveyRenderChunk(tree, subject, treq, page_data, show_errors, request_errors=None):
Parameters:
  • tree (an ElementTree instance) – The MTS Messages tree for the current survey page
  • subject (a tailoring.subjects.Subject instance) – the current subject with current survey data
  • treq (a TailoringRequest instance) – the TailoringRequest for the current page
  • page_data (a dictionary) – the map of characteristic names to values for the current page.
  • show_errors (a boolean) – dictates whether validate commands in the tree will be shown or not.
  • request_errors (a list of surveytracking.projectutils.InvalidDataErrors) – the list of type errors that will be re-inserted into the rendered output.

Encapsulates all of the relevant information to send to the tailoring engine for rendering a single page of a survey.

Clients will primarily be familiar with this as the context item that the render_survey_segment tag uses to output a page of survey form elements.

djangotailoring.surveys.views.render.has_content(self)¶
Return type:a boolean
Returns:whether the current tailored output has any renderable content.
djangotailoring.surveys.views.render.has_errors(self)¶
Return type:a boolean
Returns:whether the set of objects will result in any errors.
djangotailoring.surveys.views.render.render(self)¶
Return type:an ElementTree instance
Returns:a rendered ElementTree of the final HTML-ified survey output.
